image.alt: Modern orthodontic office exterior and smiling team at Leavitt Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Welcome! Dr. Leavitt and his team pride themselves on giving you and your smile the attention it deserves. Our outstanding personal service, advanced orthodontic technology, flexible scheduling, and a doctor-driven, patient-centered approach create a friendly, family atmosphere where you’ll feel like part of a community.
One Doctor. One Location. One Focus—YOU! We make treatment accessible and comfortable for patients of all ages, with clear communication and care designed around your life.

items.title: Personalized Care
items.text: We’re a doctor-driven, patient-centered practice — warm, respectful, and focused on you and your smile.

items.title: Invisalign & Tech
items.text: Certified Invisalign<sup>®</sup> provider offering discreet clear aligners and modern orthodontic techniques for efficient, comfortable care.

items.title: Flexible Payments
items.text: Personalized, flexible payment plans — including options with low or zero down — to make treatment affordable for your family.

items.title: Local, Doctor-Led
items.text: One Doctor. One Location. One Focus—YOU. Local care centered on long-term results and a great patient experience.

paragraphs.text: Tyler Leavitt, DDS, MSD was born in Pocatello and raised in Blackfoot. Dr. Leavitt trained at Creighton University School of Dentistry, graduating with honors, and completed his orthodontic residency at Saint Louis University. He earned multiple awards and society inductions for academic and clinical excellence, and he is passionate about treating patients like family and helping them gain confidence through great smiles. Certified Invisalign<sup>®</sup> Provider.

image.alt: Dr. Tyler Leavitt headshot

paragraphs.text: From traditional braces to Invisalign<sup>®</sup> clear aligners, we offer a range of services to suit every patient.

og_meta.description: Leavitt Orthodontics in Pocatello, ID offers personalized, doctor-driven orthodontics including Invisalign®, braces, and retainers. Call (208) 237-3330.

image.alt: Dr. Tyler Leavitt and team smiling in the Leavitt Orthodontics office

paragraphs.text: One Doctor. One Location. One Focus — YOU! Our office in Pocatello, Idaho is open and welcoming new patients. We want your experience to be comfortable, fun, and memorable. We can’t wait to meet you and your smile.

The Leavitt difference is simple: a doctor-driven, patient-centered practice that treats you like family. We’re warm, respectful, and passionate about creating confident smiles through individualized care.
Certified Invisalign<sup>®</sup> Provider, we offer Invisalign and metal braces plus personalized payment plans, including flexible options to fit your budget.
Using advanced technology, gentle techniques, and convenient scheduling, we make orthodontic care accessible for the whole family.

image.alt: Dr. Tyler Leavitt headshot

paragraphs.text: Tyler Leavitt, DDS, MSD, is an orthodontist and the founder of Leavitt Orthodontics in Pocatello. He provides doctor-led care focused on clear communication and personal attention. Dr. Leavitt treats patients of all ages with Invisalign<sup>®</sup> and metal braces and is a Certified Invisalign Provider.

image.alt: Dr. Tyler Leavitt smiling in the office

paragraphs.text: Dr. Leavitt earned his Doctor of Dental Surgery at Creighton University School of Dentistry and completed his orthodontic residency and Master of Science at Saint Louis University — Center for Advanced Dental Education. He graduated with honors at Creighton and received awards from the American Association of Orthodontists, and was inducted into Alpha Sigma Nu and Omicron Kappa Upsilon honor societies.

image.alt: Diplomas and professional recognition

paragraphs.text: Born in Pocatello and raised in Blackfoot, Idaho, Dr. Leavitt returned home to serve southeastern Idaho. He enjoys getting to know patients personally, making them laugh, and treating them like family. Outside the office he participates in community events and enjoys supporting local schools and programs.

image.alt: Dr. Leavitt with the team at a community event

slides.alt: Office open house and ribbon cutting

paragraphs.text: Leavitt Orthodontics enjoys giving back through school activities, patient appreciation events, and community fundraisers. Highlights include a coloring contest that supports local PTOs, pool parties for patients, teacher appreciation programs, and our open house ribbon cutting. Downloadable resources and contest materials are available on our site.

image.alt: Graphic representing community support by Leavitt Orthodontics
Enjoying time together

image.alt: Bright, welcoming orthodontic office reception with smiling team

Get Started.title: What to expect at your first visit

paragraphs.text: Your first visit begins with a friendly welcome and a chance to meet Dr. Tyler Leavitt and the team. We will review your concerns, take a complete oral exam and necessary X-rays, and answer your questions so you leave with a clear understanding of your options.

During the consultation we’ll discuss recommended treatments, timing, and estimated costs. Bring any recent dental records or insurance information; expect a relaxed, thorough visit with time to plan the next steps and schedule a complimentary consultation if you'd like to move forward.

image.alt: Dr. Tyler Leavitt smiling in clinic, portrait

paragraphs.text: We accept most major insurance plans and will file claims electronically to make billing easier. Our team will verify benefits and answer any questions about coverage before treatment begins.
Flexible payment plans are available, including options that let you start with zero down. Learn more about our financing options on the financing page: /financing.

To save time at your appointment, complete our online forms or download PDFs from the contact page. Typical fields include name, contact details, medical history, and basic appointment information. Some forms use Google reCAPTCHA for security.

image.alt: Patients and staff during an office open house, friendly reception area
Enjoying time together

og_meta.title: Get Started | Leavitt Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Start your orthodontic journey with a free consultation. Learn what to expect, complete new patient forms, and explore financing options.

image.alt: Smiling patients of all ages at Lakeshore Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: At Leavitt Orthodontics, Dr. Tyler Leavitt offers Invisalign<sup>®</sup> clear aligners as a discreet, removable option. Advanced 3D imaging helps us design a precise series of aligners that move teeth gently and predictably.
With aligners you can brush and floss normally and enjoy fewer dietary restrictions. New patients can watch our Invisalign onboarding video to learn what to expect during treatment.

image.alt: Close-up of Invisalign aligners being placed on teeth

paragraphs.text: Dr. Tyler Leavitt provides durable metal braces, a reliable choice for a wide range of alignment needs. Braces use brackets and wires to apply steady forces and correct bite and tooth position.
Durable and cost-effective, metal braces use small brackets and wires to gradually move teeth into place.

image.alt: Dental Checkup with Braces

paragraphs.text: Ceramic braces blend with your tooth color for a less noticeable option without sacrificing effectiveness.

image.alt: Smiling Woman with Clear Aligner
Two stylish smiling teens taking selfie with braces

paragraphs.text: The Damon bracket system is one of the appliance options we use to enhance smile aesthetics. By positioning brackets to support the natural smile arc, Damon appliances can help achieve a fuller, more natural-looking smile in many cases.

image.alt: Close-up of a smiling person's mouth showing white teeth, with a yellow outline highlighting the smile line.

paragraphs.text: Traditional brackets remain highly effective for complex corrections. Their placement and mechanics let us manage tooth movement precisely, though bracket position and mechanics can influence smile shape.

image.alt: Close-up of a person's upper front teeth with orthodontic braces and clear brackets.

paragraphs.text: Smile arc protection is a bracket-placement philosophy that preserves the natural curve of the smile. By planning bracket position with the smile arc in mind, we aim to create a more natural, aesthetic result.

image.alt: Close-up of a person's smile showing upper and lower teeth, with a yellow line indicating the gum line.

paragraphs.text: Essix retainers are clear, custom-fit appliances made to maintain your smile. They are nearly invisible, comfortable, and easy to wear for daytime or nighttime retention.
Because Essix retainers are removable, they require routine care and occasional replacement if worn or damaged. We can help you choose the best retainer for your needs.

image.alt: The Importance Of A Retainer

paragraphs.text: Bonded retainers are thin wires permanently attached to the back of teeth. They offer continuous support without removal, which many patients prefer for long-term stability.
Fixed retainers require dedicated cleaning care to keep the teeth and gums healthy. Our team will show you how to floss and care for a bonded retainer properly.

image.alt: Beautiful young Asian woman smiling and holding orthodontic retainer

paragraphs.text: If your retainer is lost or damaged, call our office right away. We will work quickly to get you a replacement or discuss next steps to protect your smile.
Act quickly: teeth can shift fast without retainer support. The sooner you replace or repair the retainer, the better the chance of preserving your results.
Keeping your smile beautiful is a team effort. Follow home care instructions, wear your retainer as directed, and contact us with any concerns. We’re here to help.

image.alt: Office staff ready to assist patients
Enjoying time together

image.alt: Smiling patient in an orthodontic treatment chair

paragraphs.text: Find clear, practical answers to common questions about braces, Invisalign<sup>®</sup>, appointments, payments, and what to do in an emergency at Leavitt Orthodontics in Pocatello.

accordion.header: What orthodontic treatments do you offer?

paragraphs.text: We provide traditional metal and clear ceramic braces for children, teens, and adults, Invisalign<sup>®</sup> clear aligners for discreet treatment, and custom retainers to protect your results. At your first visit we’ll review options and recommend the best plan for your goals.

image.alt: Family smiling after orthodontic treatment

accordion.header: At what age should my child see an orthodontist?

paragraphs.text: The American Association of Orthodontists recommends an evaluation by age 7. Early visits let us monitor jaw and tooth development and, when needed, begin simple treatments that can reduce future complexity.

image.alt: Parent and child smiling at the orthodontist

accordion.header: How long does treatment usually take?

paragraphs.text: Treatment time depends on the complexity of the case. Many patients complete active treatment in about 12 to 24 months. During your consultation we’ll create a personalized timeline and explain what to expect at each stage.

image.alt: Orthodontic team reviewing a treatment plan

accordion.header: How do I care for braces, aligners, and what should I do in an emergency?

paragraphs.text: For braces, avoid hard or sticky foods, brush after every meal, and use a floss threader to clean between wires. For Invisalign<sup>®</sup>, wear your aligners 20 to 22 hours daily, clean trays with a soft brush and lukewarm water, and remove them for eating. If a bracket becomes loose or a wire is poking, use orthodontic wax to reduce irritation and call us for a repair. For severe pain, uncontrolled bleeding, or suspected broken appliance, contact our office right away.

image.alt: Close-up of orthodontic braces care tools

accordion.header: What payment and insurance options are available, and how can I schedule an appointment?

paragraphs.text: We offer flexible monthly payment plans and accept most major dental insurance plans. Our front desk will walk you through coverage and out-of-pocket estimates. To schedule, call (208) 237-3330 or request an appointment online at https://drleavittortho.com/contact and we’ll find a time that fits your schedule.

image.alt: Reception area with smiling staff ready to assist
Enjoying time together
